org.catechis.juksong
Class WebWord

java.lang.Object
  org.catechis.juksong.WebWord

public class WebWord
extends java.lang.Object

Utilities for looking up words from the web. Impact Dictionary requires searches to be in encoding = "euc-kr"; tried UTF-8 but it didn't work. Got a message from impact: 다음 문자들은 키워드에 포함될 수 없습니다. "The following characters can not be included" "; ^ , " | < > [ ] { } ( ) * & ~ \" from http://dic.impact.pe.kr/ecmaster-cgi/search.cgi?kwd=%B2%CF%2C+%C1%A6%B9%FD&bool=and&word=yes in indoct when trying to look up 꽤, 제법 pretty much

Author:
a

WebWord

WebWord

public WebWord(java.lang.String _address)

WebWord

public WebWord(java.lang.String _type,
               java.lang.String _native_language,
               java.lang.String _language_being_learned)
This constructor should be used with various online dictionries.

Parameters:
_type - of test.
_native_language - is used to exclude this language from reading test lookups.
_language_being_learned - for the opposite reason. Reading tests have text as the question and definitions as answers. Writing tests have definitions as questions and texts as answers. If native language is English, Language being learned is Korean, a reading test lookup result:
back out 철회, 탈퇴, 변절
a writing test lookup result:
withdrawn 내성적인, 인적이 드문
This is for the word text = definition 탈퇴 = withdraw If native language is Korean, Language being learned is English, text is English, definition is Korean(or English) text = definition withdraw = 탈퇴 This is important because we want to srtip out all non-ascii text from reading definitions. And all ascii from writing questions.

verifyParse

private boolean verifyParse(java.lang.String text,
                            java.lang.String definition)
The problem with checking if a line contains both text and definition, is that this might cover for a misspelled text or definition, if just one of them checks out. Also, advanced users define a word in the language being learned, which might contain the original text, or part of it.

Parameters:
text -
definition -
Returns:

verifyWord

public void verifyWord(Word word)
To use this method, the caller is responsible for setting the encoding, and getting the definition results and examples. This is a separate method as it takes longer to verify a word. This includes saving definitions and examples for each lookup of text and definition.

word -

    [edit] Verb

    시키다 (sikida) infinitive 시켜 or 시키어, sequential 시키니

    1. to cause to do or happen
      2. first_mark starts with

      ... save text in id="Verb" for latter grab. second mark

    private void parseWikiEnglishToKoreanLine(java.lang.String input_line)
    First type: first mark

    tag, next line starts

  • 1. Then parse for text in the 시키다 tag

    타동사 (vt) 

    • 1. (목적어 + 동사원형) 시키다, 하게 하다.

      • 동사

      attack

      • 1. 공격하다, 침범하다.
      Format for: http://ko.wiktionary.org/wiki/white ...

      형용사

      1st mark, save line ... multiple lines and then two definitions of type 'adjective' or 형영사 ...
    • 1. 하얗다, 희다.
      • ... multiple lines followed by two definitions of type 'noun' or 명사 ... ... the next first mark is

      명사

      하양, 흰색. 3rd mark, parse for multiple defs which all use the same grammer found in the parsed saved line above

    The The resulting grammar hash should be: adjective - 하얗다 adjective - 희다 noun - 하양 noun - 흰색

    getWikiGrammarType

    private java.lang.String getWikiGrammarType()
    Search for grammar definitions. Korean to English definitions have more complex formats. Like this:

    타동사 (vt) 

    for grammar names in EnglishGrammar labels. Grammar is '...title="transitive verb"...' or:

    [edit] Adverb

    Grammar is '...id="Adverb">Adverb<...' How to tell the difference between transitive verb and transitive???

    Returns:
    EnglishGrammar.undetermined if no grammar match is found otherwise returns the first definition that matches a grammar type in the list.

    resolveGrammarType

    private void resolveGrammarType(java.util.Vector candidates,
                                java.util.Vector grammar_labels)
    At this point in the search for a grammar type, there are multiple candidates that have matched, such as transitive, and transitive verb. To distinguish which one it is, we must capture the text in the title="transitive verb" part of the anchor tag, which has been saved in the grammar_name global variable, and then determine which candidate it is.

    Parameters:
    candidates -
    grammar_labels -

    parseImpactLine

    public void parseImpactLine(java.lang.String line)
    The search text for dic.impact.pe.k must use the euc-kr encoding. There are two types of definitions we want to capture and one we want to exclude: Format #1 The first format we are trying to parse has definitions like this:

    berry £Û£â¢¥£å£ò£é£Ý ¿­¸Å, µþ±âÀÇ ¿­¸Å, Ä¿ÇÇÀÇ ¿­¸Å, ¹°°í±âÀÇ ¾Ë-¿­¸Å°¡ ¿­¸® ´Ù, ¿­¸Å¸¦ µû´Ù berry ［ｂ´ｅｒｉ］ 열매, 딸기의 열매, 커피의 열매, 물고기의 알-열매가 열리다, 열매를 따다 The script element appears only on the first definition. The COLOR=557756 is the optional [pronunciation] guide. The COLOR=8080FF is the blue colored search text in the example sentences. In this case, we searched for the Korean verb in infinitive form 'to open' The definition we were looking for was 15th in a list of hundreds of words and full paragraphs. the correct definition looked like this (we added the s): open 열리다, 넓어지다, 시작하다, 보이게 되다, ~ into ...로 통하다, ~ on ...에 면하다, ~ one's eyes 깜짝 놀라다, ~ out 열다, ~ the door to ...에 기회를 주다, ~ up 열다, ~ly ad, 솔직히, 공공연히 The html for this was:

    open ¿­¸® ´Ù, ³Ð¾îÁö´Ù, ½ÃÀÛÇÏ´Ù, º¸ÀÌ°Ô µÇ´Ù, ~ into ...·Î ÅëÇÏ´Ù, ~ on ...¿¡ ¸éÇÏ´Ù, ~ one's eyes ±ôÂ¦ ³î¶ó´Ù, ~ out ¿­´Ù, ~ the door to ...¿¡ ±âÈ¸¸¦ ÁÖ´Ù, ~ up ¿­´Ù, ~ly ad, ¼ÖÁ÷È÷, °ø°ø¿¬È÷ So to do a spell check, we need to search for all parts of the definition, allowing options to be set for exclusions such as 'to ' and also collect all these other examples as definitions (blue font included) with optional pronunciations guides and grammatical variations shown in the correct definition above. Format #2 This is the 2nd format we are looking for: 200
    201 202
    203 untapped ¸¶°³°¡ ¿­¸®Ao ¾EAº, ≫c¿eμCAo ¾EAº, ¹I°³¹ßAC 204
    Or possibly with no HR: 114
    115 berry £Û£â¢¥£å£ò£é£Ý ¿­¸Å, µþ±âÀÇ ¿­¸Å, Ä¿ÇÇÀÇ ¿­¸Å, ¹°°í±âÀÇ ¾Ë-¿­¸Å°¡ ¿­¸®´Ù, ¿­¸Å¸¦ µû´Ù 116
    From this log output, it looks like the definition is coming after a br tag. Format #3 (Exclude from definition results, but capture in separate examples Vector) We want to exclude multiple line text examples from definition results which have a format like this:

    I have two tickets to a classical music concert this Saturday.
    Will you go there with me?
    이번 주 토요일에 열리는 고전 음악회 표 두 장이 있어. 같이 갈래?

    Knock at the door and it will be open.
    두드려라 그러면 열리리라.

    A golden key opens every door.
    ⇒ Money makes the mare go.
    ⇒ Money talks.
    돈으로 안 열리는 문이 없다.
    Notice there are multiple
    tags for this type. Therefore, we have a bracket_counter, which if it goes over 1 before another
    , We can exclude the definition. However, we wont know this until after the second
    , which if we find id, we want to delete the last added definition, and then return the Vector, As these text examples always come at the end of the dictionary style entries. All these types of parsing are demonstrated in the testParse() method. The 'if else if' blocks work backwards. For instance, the when the first horizontal rule is found, the marker is set in the last else if block.

    Parameters:
    text -
    encoding -

    parseImpactDefinitionLine

    public void parseImpactDefinitionLine(java.lang.String line)
    This method only looks up words for English speaking Korean Learners Reading texts

    Parameters:
    line -

    trimUnwanted

    public java.lang.String trimUnwanted(java.lang.String line)
    If the language being learned is English, then the text is in English, and the definition should be in another language (like Korean) So for a reading test, we want to remove all the ascii characters from the definition, and for a writing test, we want to do the opposite. If a Korean student is learning English, a reading tests shows an English word that the student types in a Korean word to pass. In this situation, the student would want to see a list of similar answers from the web, such that a list of only English translations of the word should be shown. So we should remove all characters except English text from the result.

    trimNonAscii

    public java.lang.String trimNonAscii(java.lang.String definition)
    Keep moving the end_mark closer if non-askii characters are found, then return the string from the beginning to the mark. Then call trimTrailingNonLetters to remove non-letter endings.

    Parameters:
    definition -
    Returns:

    trimAscii

    public java.lang.String trimAscii(java.lang.String definition)
    Based on trimNonAscii but instead excludes all ascii characters. We need to take a line like this: withdrawn 내성적인, 인적이 드문 And produce one like this: 내성적인, 인적이 드문 We had a failing testTrimmAscii test because of the EncodeString.encodeThis() statement.

    captureSecondFormat

    private java.lang.String captureSecondFormat(java.lang.String line)
    Add characters up until the frist non-letter. try { char c = line.charAt(line.length()-1); // cases error??? if (String.valueOf(c).equals(">")) { bracket_marker = true; log.add("WebWord.bracket marker set to true"+line); } else { // reset all markers??? bracket_marker = false; horizontal_rule_marker = false; first_horizontal_rule_marker = false; } } catch (java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException sioobe) { log.add("sioobe at line "+i+" couldn't set braket marker"+line); String second_format = captureSecondFormat(line); if (second_format != null) { results.add(second_format); log.add("WebWord.lookup: definition added by second form: "+second_format); } }

    Parameters:
    line -
    Returns:
    the numeric value of the character, as a nonnegative int value; -2 if the character has a numeric value that is not a nonnegative integer; -1 if the character has no numeric value. This method cannot handle supplementary characters. To support all Unicode characters, including supplementary characters, use the getNumericValue(int) method.

    getOgdensEnglish

    public java.util.Hashtable getOgdensEnglish()
    Parse Ogdens 850 Basic English Words. Returns a hash with words as keys and categories as values. The first category on Wikitionary looks like this: Category Title: Operations

    [edit] Operations - 100 words

    come, get, give, go, keep, ... 400 general words Next is a category heading like this -> [edit] 400 general wordsA-F

    [edit] 400 general words

    A-F

    account, act, ... first mark '

    testWritingParse

    private java.util.Vector testWritingParse()
    This method should yeild the following results: 철회, 탈퇴, 변절 분리기, 절단, 탈주, 무리에서 이탈한 동물, 일탈, 탈퇴, 출발 신호전에 뛰어 나감, 공을 갖고 골로 돌진하기 (단체에서)...을 제명하다, (...와)인연을 끊다, 탈퇴하다 탈퇴하다 회원에서 탈퇴하고 싶습니다. 민주노총의 노사정 (勞使政) 위원회 탈퇴로 우려하던 상황이 결국 현실로"); 나타나고 말았다. 한국노총도 26일 대의원대회를 열고 노사정위 조건부 탈퇴를 선언할 움직임이어서 노사정위는 출범 13개월만에 좌초 위기에 빠지고 대립과 갈등의 소모적인 노사관계가 재현될 가능성이 커졌다. In this case we want to keep the text in the tags. The two longer multiple line text examples should be excluded.
